Congratulations to Judah Sung, Presidio School graduating class of 2020!

Here in these pictures you can see Judah marching back from cadet basic training at West Point!!

Judah recently completed his month of cadet basic training at West Point. He reported back that he loves it, but it is hard, and credited his mother for pushing him so hard to get him there. He went through the gas chamber, rappelled, shot weapons, threw hand grenades, shot a mortar, completed land navigation, called for a 9-line medevac, did a lot of running, push ups and physical training, and of course a lot of drill and ceremony.

We are so proud of you, Judah!! Keep working hard.

Today Presidio began hosting individual graduation ceremonies for all of our seniors! This was the first of three days of ceremonies where each student can take pictures, make their walk in their cap and gown, give a speech, collect their diploma, and take informal pictures with family and friends. Each ceremony is streamed so that teachers, family, and friends can participate and help the graduates to celebrate the momentous occasion. Each individual ceremony will then be edited to make one graduation video of all the ceremonies together for our 2020 graduates. Congratulations to the Presidio class of 2020!

Extra special shoutout to videographer, Pete Gonzales, from The Human Connection Studio who will be putting together the final video for our students at no cost to Presidio. Thank you so much, Pete!

Dear Presidio Family,

I hope your new year treated you all well thus far. Due to circumstances beyond our control, Mr. Bretney was not able to join Presidio. I would like to introduce Webb Eliscu, our new 8th grade Social Studies and Writing teacher. Webb comes to us from Tanque Verde school district where he taught 7th and 8th grade Social Studies. He has a wealth of experience and knowledge. Webb has been spending time on campus this week and will officially begin teaching on February 3. We are thrilled to welcome "Mr. E," as he prefers to be called, to the #PresidioFamily.

Happy Saturday!

Jessica Montierth Puls

On Thursday, Presidio School middle and high school students were given an opportunity to experience the potential consequences of distracted and impaired driving in a controlled environment via UNITE’s Arrive Alive Tour®. post_text: We are excited to announce that Presidio School has partnered with the Tucson Symphony Orchestra (TSO). Ms. Tanya Cuthbertson, Presidio's music teacher, and member of the TSO will work with Presidio School 4th and 5th grade students to enhance their knowledge of orchestra instruments, to understand the logistics of ensemble performances, and apply their knowledge through in class performances. Ms. Tanya is working diligently with the students to teach them how to read music and manipulate and care for orchestra instruments in preparation for the TSO members' visits. In May, all 4th and 5th grade students will have the opportunity to visit the Tucson Symphony Orchestra and hear a live performance! We are incredibly proud of this partnership and the opportunities it provides to our students. Thank you, TSO and Ms. Tanya, for all you are doing for our students!
